cooked: If more-than-64bit arithmetic is desired, then I would say rustyrussell’s idea of using only-positive variable-length integers where larger lengths are allowed is more elegant, and coupled with FIXNUM (or maybe TOFIXNUM/FROMFIXNUM) opcode to convert between variable and fixed encodings, and BYTEREV to convert between low/big endian, that would cover a large range of practical needs
raw: If more-than-64bit arithmetic is desired, then I would say rustyrussell's idea of using only-positive variable-length integers where larger lengths are allowed is more elegant, and coupled with `FIXNUM` (or maybe `TOFIXNUM`/`FROMFIXNUM`) opcode to convert between variable and fixed encodings, and `BYTEREV` to convert between low/big endian, that would cover a large range of practical needs
